author: McBuffenFitness

text: Oh gods, the childhood memories of this game. I played the hell out of this at my grandmother's house when we would spend time with her during the summer and on holidays. She had the coolest Nintendo library and this was one of my favorites. The final level had to be the hardest one to get through though, specially since I couldn't figure out the penguin boss for ages. Thanks SupraDarky! You have some classy taste in VGMs! <3

author: IceHockeyJedi

text: This was a pretty good 2D platformer, which isn't too surprising since Capcom was awesome at making those during that era. This is the final stage theme and I thought it was probably composed by someone who worked on the Mega Man series, but it's actually not the case. Tamiya is mainly known for her music on Bionic Commando, she was only active from 1987 to 1990, ending her VGM career with this game.
author: SupraDarky
